## Plot

```{r cache = TRUE, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

Carseats_plot <- 
  ggplot(Carseats, aes(x = Price, y = Sales)) +
  geom_point() + 
  facet_wrap(Carseats$Urban) + theme(plot.margin = margin(1,1,1,1, 'cm'))

Carseats_plot <- Carseats_plot + labs(ylab = 'Number of carseats sold', xlab = 'Price of carseats in dollars')

ggplotly(Carseats_plot) %>% 
  layout(title = list(text = paste0("Relationship between price of carseats, and sales of carseats", 
  '<br>',
  '<sup>',
  'Split on rural and urban areas',
  '</sup>'
    
  )))



```

## Code and a formula

Some code that I use for a tiny part of my thesis. 

```{r code thesis, eval = FALSE, echo = TRUE}

crit_p_rob <- function(time_windows, electrodes) {
  
  crit_p <- sqrt(0.05 / ((time_windows -1) * electrodes))
  
  return(crit_p)
}


```

Nice to show the same thing in a formula


$$P_{crit} = \sqrt{\dfrac{0.05} {(timewindows - 1) * electrodes}}$$
[@Formula]
